title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that total revenue will decrease and/or does not explain that demand is price elastic in this price range; or use numbers to explain that the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage increase in price, the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1, or the total revenue decreases.

The response states that total revenue will decrease and explains that demand is price elastic in this price range; or uses numbers to explain that the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage increase in price, the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1, or the total revenue decreases.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, the firm is not producing at the allocatively efficient quantity and/or does not explain that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve (at 40 units).

The response states that no, the firm is not producing at the allocatively efficient quantity and explains that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve (at 40 units).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at 40 units the firm’s economic profit is positive and/or does not explain that the price is above the ATC.
The response states that at 40 units the firm’s economic profit is positive and explains that the price is above the ATC.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain that at 20 units marginal cost is less than average total cost, which means that the cost of producing the next unit is lower than the average total cost, which pulls down the average total cost for the next unit.

The response explains that at 20 units marginal cost is less than average total cost, which means that the cost of producing the next unit is lower than the average total cost, which pulls down the average total cost for the next unit.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the consumer surplus as $180 and/or does not show the work:

Consumer Surplus =  1 2 (30)($40−$28)=$180 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaae4Bai aab6gacaqGZbGaaeyDaiaab2gacaqGLbGaaeOCaiaabccacaqGtbGa aeyDaiaabkhacaqGWbGaaeiBaiaabwhacaqGZbGaaeiiaiabg2da9i aabccadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIYaaaaiaacIcacaaIZaGaaGim aiaacMcacaGGOaGaaiijaiaaisdacaaIWaGaeyOeI0Iaaiijaiaaik dacaaI4aGaaiykaiabg2da9iaacscacaaIXaGaaGioaiaaicdaaaa@58AB@

The response calculates the consumer surplus as $180 and shows the work:
